answers.answer: Hi....u do not have to have headaches in order to have migraines...please see the health pages (icon top right of this screen) there is info on the types of migranes.I hope this was of help!"selma"
Of course it could also be due to many other things too. You should probably have a work up done by your PC doctor.

Hi,The possibility of migraines cannot be ruled out especially if you have a positive family history of migraines. Migraines can occur with or without headaches and tingling numbness on one side of the body is a symptom of migraine. However it is important to rule out other possibilities also like peripheral neuropathy due to diabetes, B 12 deficiency and thyroid dysfunction. TIA can also cause these symptoms although in TIA the onset of these symptoms is acute.I would suggest you to get a clinical exam done by your GP and discuss these possibilities with him.Keep us posted!

question: I am a 30 year old female and would say i am healthy. Lately i have been havin sharp pains and then tingling all throught my left side. I was told by a doctor this is do to migraines. though I am not getting headaches. is this true or is it something else i should be aware of. thank you
title: sharp pains and tingling
